content: **about this pattern** a whimsical brioche hood for setting out on a frosty winter s morning wear the hood up to keep ears warm or lower it when you just need the scarf super long scarf ends mean you can have fun wrapping this way and that tie them in a big bow or tuck them in the back for an extra layer of warmth this pattern was adapted from its sibling the sno cap bonnet ⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ⋅˚₊‧ ୨୧ ‧₊˚ ⋅⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ **pattern overview** the sno cap hood is knit in brioche from end to end you will start by making a long skinny scarf when it has reached the desire length you ll start working brioche increases and decreases to form the hood the project is complete when the second end of the scarf is done ⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ⋅˚₊‧ ୨୧ ‧₊˚ ⋅⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ **yarn & needles** you can use any worsted weight wool yarn for this pattern try to hit gauge for more accurate results recommended needle us 7 4 5 mm please use double pointed or circular needles you may choose to use stitch markers as you work ⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ⋅˚₊‧ ୨୧ ‧₊˚ ⋅⊹ ۪ ˑ ִ ֗ ִ ۫ ˑ **community notes** this free pattern is essentially just me sharing my notes on how i free-handed this hooded scarf for fun if you have a suggestion for improvement write me a comment or pm on ravelry i d love to hear your feedback so i can learn and improve this free pattern for others also post your project on ravelry so i can gush over your work i would love to see your fo if you feel like sharing
